page.title: 15TOURISM AROUND REETH1
page.content: {Swaledale:-} Swaledale is a valley with a river called the Swale running through it .The Swale is one of the swiftest flowing rivers in the country,ideal for canoeing. On the Harkerside side fo the valley near Reeth is a Bronze Age fortification called Maiden Castle.On the opposite side of the valley is Calva hill it is about !,600ft high.Just north of Reeth is Fremington Edge,where they used to mine churt. The ground around Reeth is chiefly limestone with only a thin layer of soil.It is because of this and the climate that the land is not tilled,but is grazed and grass is grown for hay and silage. {Tourism:- Tourists come to the Reeth area all through the year.Some comePTO>
